summary: This bill, S. 1856, introduced in the Senate on May 22, 2025, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The core of the bill proposes excluding military bonuses from gross income, allowing these payments to be tax-free. The amendment specifically replaces the existing reference to 'qualified military benefit' with military bonuses paid under chapter 5 of title 37 of the United States Code. This change would apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
